alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 8:23PM CDT until June 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHERRY...WESTERN GRANT...NORTHERN GARDEN AND SOUTHEASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 723 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Ashby to 10 miles south of Ellsworth to near Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Ashby, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Watson Lake, Rackett, Patterson Lake, Dipping Vat Meadow, Swede Lake, Finnegan Lake, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Kincaid Lake, Kennedy Lake, Wild Horse Flats, Mother Lake, Mumper, Bingham, Wolf Hill, Herman Lake and Dominick Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 112 and 142. Highway 61 near mile marker 172. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
